result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas O. Nordness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Case #16CM113-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Nordness on Probation for two years.

miscConds.notes:
--Mr. Nordness is to achieve his HSED through the Fort Atkinson High School program

--Mr. Nordness cannot get fired from Culvers; the only time he can leave this employment at Culvers is if Mr. Nordness gets a better job with more hours and the Agent approves this change in employment, or if the Agent gives approval for Mr. Nordness to start his own business as he stated he eventually intends to do

--no possession or consumption of alcohol

--no possession or ingestion of any controlled substances without a valid prescription

--to undergo any other assessment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to be subject to random urinalyses for drugs and alcohol if deemed appropriate by the Agent

--to take all prescription for medications as prescribed only

--to provide a DNA sample  

 --If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Fort Atkinson PD
--to undergo AODA assessment and treatment as required by the Agent;  to follow through with all treatment recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas O. Nordness

defendant.name: Nordness, Nicholas O.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #16CM111 an d #16CM113 called at 3:24pm. 
Defendant Nicholas O. Nordness in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Case #16CM111-Count #2 of the Amended Complaint and on Case #16CM113-Count #1 of the Amended Complaint; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (DA Happ submits a victim impact statement in Case #16CM113); the Court accepts the pleas, finds Mr. Nordness guilty, and orders Judgments of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #16CM111-Count #1.

On Case #16CM111-Count #2 and on Case #16CM113-Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Nordness on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and treatment as required by the Agent;  to follow through with all treatment
 recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapon
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to be subject to random urinalyses for drugs and alcohol if deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to take all prescription for medications as prescribed only
--Mr. Nordness is to achieve his HSED through the Fort Atkinson High School program
--Mr. Nordness cannot get fired from Culvers; the only time he can leave this employment at Culvers is if Mr. Nordness gets a better job with more hours and the Agent approves this change in employment, or if the Agent gives approval for Mr. Nordness to start his own business as he stated he eventually intends to do   
--to provide a DNA sample  
--to pay costs, fees, assessments 


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess 3:57pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 26, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

[MK] cases #16CM111 and #16CM113 called at 9:52am.
Defendant Nicholas O. Nordness in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Svehlek indicates that the Defense is prepared to proceed to changes of plea and sentencing today, however DA Happ indicates that there is not victim rights compliance. 
The Court schedules the cases for plea and sentencing on a later date.
The Court directs the State to file an Amended Complaints to memorialize the Motion that was granted at the 4/19/16 Initial Appearances to modify the Complaints to read that the Defendant did knowingly 'conceal' stolen property instead of 'receive'.
recess 9:55am. 

NEXT: schedule both cases for Plea & Sentencing on 9/ 26/16 at 3:00pm. (JA- please note in comments that the Court needs to address the filing of the [forthcoming] Amended Complaints in each case)

Copy of Email addressed to James Habeck re: Defendant with Response from Court - James Habeck is a Sawnno County Circuit Judge This was sent unsolicited by the Court. cc: Attorney Svehlek, DA - Judge Wambach
Status conference on August 16, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 22, 2016 at 11:40 am.

Cases 16CM111 & 16CM113 called together at 2:57 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Nicholas O. Nordness in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
Court continues bond as previously set
Recess: 2:59 am 

NEXT:  BOTH CASES (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 6/22/16 at 11:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 8/16/16 at 9:30 am - Send notices
Adjourned initial appearance on June 7, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 16CM111 and 16CM113 called together at 3:08pm[mo]
Defendant Nicholas O. Nordness in court.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to 16CM111 and 16CM113:
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.

The Court and ADA Teuber discuss the factual portion of Case 16CM113
ADA Teuber orally motions for for the amendment of the charging language of the complaint in 16CM113
--no objection from Mr. Nordness
The Court orders for the Complaint of 16CM113 to read did knowingly 'conceal' stolen property instead of 'receive'.

ADA Teuber orally motions for for the amendment of the charging language of the complaint in 16CM111
--no objection from Mr. Nordness
The Court orders for the Complaint of 16CM111, Count #1 to read did knowingly 'conceal' stolen property instead of 'receive'.

The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
--Mr. Nordness indicate that the does not wish to have counsel

The Court concludes that Mr. Nordness is not competent to represent himself; direct him to the SPD office                                            


The Court requires $1000  signature bond to cover both cases, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence
--no discussion of the case with parents
--curfew of 6:00pm to 7:00am, unless accompanied by a parent
recess
: 3:24pm


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 5/24/16 at 2:00pm
